Let $a,$ $b$ be two acute angles where $\tan a = 5 \tan b.$  Find the maximum possible value of $\sin (a - b).$
inference: $$\tan a = 5 \tan b \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\cos a} = 5 \frac{\sin b}{\cos b} \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\sin b} = 5 \frac{\cos b}{\cos a} \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\sin b} = 5 \frac{\sqrt{1 - \sin^2 b}}{\sqrt{1 - \sin^2 a}} \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\sin b} = 5 \frac{\sqrt{1 - \left(\frac{\sin a}{5}\right)^2}}{\sqrt{1 - \sin^2 a}} \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\sin b} = 5 \frac{\sqrt{1 - \frac{\sin^2 a}{25}}}{\sqrt{1 - \sin^2 a}} \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\sin b} = 5 \frac{\sqrt{\frac{25 - \sin^2 a}{25}}}{\sqrt{1 - \sin^2 a}} \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\sin b} = 5 \frac{\sqrt{\frac{24}{25}}}{\sqrt{1 - \sin^2 a}} \Rightarrow \frac{\sin a}{\sin b} = 5 \frac{\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{5}}{\sqrt{1 -
